services.title: Comprehensive Solutions for Your Global Needs
services.subtitle: From travel and education to international trade, we provide expert services to connect you with opportunities worldwide.

travel.title: Travel Services
travel.description: Professional travel arrangements including flight bookings to Gulf countries and comprehensive Hajj & Umrah services.

education.title: Education Consulting
education.description: Expert guidance for studying abroad, specializing in Central Asian countries including Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Uzbekistan.

trade.title: Import/Export Consulting
trade.description: Complete trade solutions for Egyptian fruit exports to Russia and Gulf countries, with quality monitoring and market analysis.

items.content: Dr White Group made our Hajj journey seamless and spiritually fulfilling. Their attention to detail and professional service exceeded our expectations.
items.author: Ahmed Al-Rashid

items.content: Thanks to their education consulting, my son is now studying medicine in Kyrgyzstan. The support from application to arrival was exceptional.
items.author: Fatima Hassan

items.content: Our fruit export business to Russia doubled after partnering with Dr White Group. Their market knowledge and connections are invaluable.
items.author: Mohamed Abdel Rahman

items.content: The team helped us establish reliable supply chains for Egyptian citrus. Their quality monitoring ensures we receive only the best products.
items.author: Dmitri Volkov

card1.title: Decades of combined experience in travel, education, and international trade

mission.title: Dr White Group bridges cultures and creates opportunities. We specialize in connecting people with their dreams - whether it's a spiritual journey, educational advancement, or business expansion across international markets.

centralAsia.title: Trips to All Central Asian Countries
centralAsia.subtitle: Discover the beauty and culture of Central Asian countries with our specialized services

countries.name: Kyrgyzstan
countries.description: Kyrgyzstan is a country whose cities, including the capital Bishkek, have low crime rates comparable to European capitals, while its mountainous countryside is home to some of the friendliest people.

countries.name: Uzbekistan
countries.description: Uzbekistan is a country located in Central Asia. Its capital and largest city is Tashkent. It has a population of approximately 34.8 million people, according to 2023 estimates. Its neighboring countries are Afghanistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan.

countries.name: Tajikistan
countries.description: Tajikistan is a country located in Central Asia, surrounded by Afghanistan, China, Kyrgyzstan, and Uzbekistan. It is famous for its rugged mountains, which are an ideal destination for long-distance hiking and mountain climbing. The Fan Mountains are located near the national capital Dushanbe.

gulfCountries.title: Explore the Gulf Countries with Us
gulfCountries.subtitle: Distinctive trips to the most beautiful Gulf Arab countries with the best services

countries.name: United Arab Emirates
countries.description: The United Arab Emirates, or simply the UAE, is a country located in West Asia, in the Middle East. It is located at the eastern tip of the Arabian Peninsula, sharing borders with Oman and Saudi Arabia, as well as maritime borders in the Arabian Gulf with Qatar and Iran.

countries.name: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
countries.description: The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, officially the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, is a country located in West Asia and the Middle East. It covers most of the Arabian Peninsula, with an area of approximately 2,150,000 square kilometers, making it the fifth largest country in Asia and the largest country in the Middle East.

countries.name: Oman
countries.description: Oman, officially the Sultanate of Oman, is a country located in West Asia. It is located on the southeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, extending along the Arabian Gulf. It shares land borders with Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, and Yemen.
